content: My mentor and I had a deep dive into the ethical implications of AI in trading. We're now exploring how to quantify fairness in financial models. It's a complex but crucial topic.
Woke up early to finalize my presentation slides. Added a slide on how AI can balance speed and fairness in trading. It's a delicate balance, but I think I've captured it.
Had a video call with the tech leader from the city planning commission. We're setting up a small-scale AI pilot for traffic management. This could be a stepping stone.
Spent the day documenting the recent trading loss. Turned it into a case study for industry knowledge. It's not just about learning from mistakes, but sharing those lessons.
Family dinner turned into a mini tech debate. Had to explain why my AI model is different from others. Their curiosity keeps me grounded in my work's real-world impact.
Last minute tweaks to my presentation. I've decided to add a live demo. It's risky, but it'll show the board how my model works in real-time, addressing their ethical concerns.
My mentor's feedback was invaluable. We're now looking at how to measure the societal impact of AI in trading. This could be the next big step in my research.
